variant.name: All
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics for all bubbles

variant.name: DownloadBubbleContentsView
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics DownloadBubbleContentsView bubbles

variant.name: ExtensionsMenuView
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics for ExtensionsMenuView bubbles

variant.name: PageInfoBubbleViewBase
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics for PageInfoBubbleViewBase bubbles

variant.name: PermissionPromptBaseView
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics for PermissionPromptBaseView bubbles

variant.name: ProfileMenuViewBase
variant.summary: Aggregated metrics for ProfileMenuViewBase bubbles

variant.name: .Image
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a (non-link) image.

variant.name: .ImageLink
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for an image which is also a link.

variant.name: .Link
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a (non-image) link

variant.name: .LinkWithInterestFor
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a link (image or non-image) that has the `interestfor` attribute.

variant.name: .Page
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a page.

variant.name: .SharedHighlightingInteraction
variant.summary: The context menu was shown from tap on highlighted text.

variant.name: .Video
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a video

variant.name: InfoBar
variant.summary: the startup infobar

variant.name: SettingsPage
variant.summary: the settings page

variant.name: ShellIntegration
variant.summary: the shell integration setter
1 to 5 tabs
6 to 20 tabs
21 or more tabs

histogram.name: Bubble.{BubbleName}.CloseReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason a bubble was closed.

histogram.name: Bubble.{BubbleName}.CreateToPresentationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes from a bubble construction to when the compositor finishes the first presentation.

histogram.name: Bubble.{BubbleName}.CreateToVisibleTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes from a bubble construction to when the bubble becomes visible.

histogram.name: Bubble.{BubbleName}.TimeVisible
histogram.summary: Records the time a bubble is visible.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.LensSupportStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user supports the Lens intent and if not, the reason why. Recorded only if the feature is enabled when the long-press context menu is shown for an image.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid{Type}
histogram.summary:
{Type}
The option that the user selected from a context menu on Android. This is logged on Android only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop for desktop. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop{ContextMenuTypeDesktop}
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a context menu on desktop. This is logged on desktop only; check out ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS for iOS, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid for Android. Note that if a menu is invoked on mixed content, only one of the submetrics receives the log; read the code to determine which one. {ContextMenuTypeDesktop}

variant.name: .Image
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a (non-link) image

variant.name: .ImageLink
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for an image which is also a link

variant.name: .MisspelledWord
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a misspelt word

variant.name: .Other
variant.summary: The context menu was shown in a context other than those explicitly enumerated

variant.name: .SelectedText
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a text selection

variant.name: .Video
variant.summary: The context menu was shown for a video

histogram.name: ContextMenu.Shown{Type}
histogram.summary:
{Type}
Recorded when a context menu is shown, sliced by whether a web contents was present. (It generally should be; indeed, this code path should not be followed when it is absent. For instance, invoking a context menu from the new tab page or from the sad tab page will not cause an emission to this histogram.) Note that this refers to link context menus, not the cut-copy-paste context menus that can appear during long presses on text on a web page or long presses in the omnibox. This is an Android-only metric; compare with RenderViewContextMenu.Shown and RenderViewContextMenu.Used on desktop.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.TimeToSelectShare
histogram.summary: Records how long it takes to press on "Share" from the time context menu is shown. Android only.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.ViewsTextServices.Emoji
histogram.summary: Number of times the emoji item in the views text services context menu is used.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InfoBar.TimesShownBeforeAccept
histogram.summary: Times the default browser info bar has been shown before the user accepted the prompt.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.InfoBar.UserInteraction
histogram.summary: Possible user interactions with the default browser info bar.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.PinInfoBar.UserInteraction
histogram.summary: User interaction with the pin-to-taskbar infobar (e.g., accepted, ignored, dismissed).

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.State
histogram.summary:
Whether Chrome was the default browser when it started up.
Only logged correctly on Windows and Mac. Logged incorrectly on other platforms. On Linux, this histogram is no longer logged as of 2021/10/18 due to browser test hangs. See crbug.com/1216328.
For ChromeOS, no histogram is necessary because Chrome is always the default browser.
For Android, see Mobile.DefaultBrowser.State.
For iOS, in the future Chrome will be allowed to be the default browser. How that will be logged is to be decided at the time of writing this description.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.{DefaultBrowserEntrypointType}.Interaction
histogram.summary: Records the action taken by user when presented with an option to set Chrome as the default browser from {DefaultBrowserEntrypointType}.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.{DefaultBrowserEntrypointType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Records how many times {DefaultBrowserEntrypointType} entrypoint was shown to the user.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.{DefaultBrowserSetterType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records whether setting Chrome as the default browser was successful using {DefaultBrowserSetterType}.

histogram.name: DefaultBrowser.{DefaultBrowserStateValidator}Result
histogram.summary:
Only logged on Windows.
Logs a comparison of the default browser state check result using the standard Win API compared to {DefaultBrowserStateValidator}. Results are relative to the Win API checker; e.g., a false-positive means the Win API detected the default browser but the alternative validator did not.

variant.name: HttpProgIdAssocValidation
variant.summary: AssocQueryString to get the HTTP default client's program ID

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.ChangeVisibleModeToNextPaintIn{VisibleMode}
histogram.summary:
Records the latency from the initiation of a visible mode change to the first paint of the button in the new {VisibleMode} mode, i.e. the duration from Reload icon to Stop icon or from Stop icon to Reload icon.
If there are multiple mode changes before the first paint, the time origin starts from the last mode change.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.InputCount
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of times the ReloadButton is activated, sliced by input type.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.InputToNextPaint{InputType}
histogram.summary:
Records the latency from a {InputType} input event to the next paint of the button.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.InputToReload{InputType}
histogram.summary:
Records the latency from a {InputType} input event to the completion of the browser's reload command execution.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.InputToStop{InputType}
histogram.summary:
Records the latency from a {InputType} input event to the completion of the browser's stop command execution.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.MouseHoverToNextPaint
histogram.summary:
Records the time from a mouseenter event on the ReloadButton to the completion of its immediate visual update (e.g., painted in hovered state).
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.ReloadButton.MousePressToNextPaint
histogram.summary:
Records the time from a mousedown event on the ReloadButton to the completion of its immediate visual update (e.g., painted in pressed state). If there are multiple mouse presses before the visual update, the time origin starts from the last mouse press.
This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics is enabled.

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.Startup{SessionRestore}.BrowserWindow.FirstPaint{StartupTemperature}
histogram.summary: Records the time from {SessionRestore} browser application startup to the first presentation of the browser window onto the screen{StartupTemperature}. . This is only recorded for desktop platforms when the InitialWebUIMetrics feature is enabled.

variant.name: .SessionRestore
variant.summary: session restored (when continue where you left off is on)

variant.name: .ColdStartup
variant.summary: , where startup was cold (mostly hard faults)

variant.name: .WarmStartup
variant.summary: , where startup was warm (almost no hard faults)

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.Startup{SessionRestore}.ReloadButton.FirstContentfulPaint{StartupTemperature}
histogram.summary: Records the time spent initializing a newly constructed ReloadButton in the {SessionRestore} browser application startup with pre/post InitialWebUI (WaaP) setup. The timer starts immediately after the browser application startup{StartupTemperature}, and ends immediately after a contentful paint of the view is requested. For browser process (pre-WaaP setup) this is equal to the InitialWebUI.Startup.ReloadButton.FirstPaint metric. For renderer process (post-WaaP setup) this might be slightly different. Only recorded on desktop platforms.

variant.name: .SessionRestore
variant.summary: session restored (when continue where you left off is on)

variant.name: .ColdStartup
variant.summary: where startup was cold (mostly hard faults)

variant.name: .WarmStartup
variant.summary: where startup was warm (almost no hard faults)

histogram.name: InitialWebUI.Startup{SessionRestore}.ReloadButton.FirstPaint{StartupTemperature}
histogram.summary: Records the time spent initializing a newly constructed ReloadButton in the {SessionRestore} browser application startup with pre/post InitialWebUI (WaaP) setup. The timer starts immediately after the browser application startup{StartupTemperature}, and ends immediately after a paint of the view is requested by either the browser process (pre-WaaP) or by the WebUI renderer process (post-WaaP). Only recorded on desktop platforms.

variant.name: .SessionRestore
variant.summary: session restored (when continue where you left off is on)

variant.name: .ColdStartup
variant.summary: where startup was cold (mostly hard faults)

variant.name: .WarmStartup
variant.summary: where startup was warm (almost no hard faults)

histogram.name: ListMenuUtils.SetupCallbacksRecursively.Duration
histogram.summary: Timing histogram for ListMenuUtils#SetupCallbacksRecursively method.

histogram.name: MenuModelBridge.AddExtensionItems.Duration
histogram.summary: Timing histogram for MenuModelBridge#AddExtensionItems method. This is recorded only for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.GetFallbackFontsTime
histogram.summary: Time retrieve the fallback fonts on the system used for RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns. This metric is known to be quite slow on bad cases.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.GetFallbackFontTime
histogram.summary: Time retrieve the preferred fallback font on the system used for RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns. Fallback font is determined based on the input text and locale.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.MissingGlyphCount
histogram.summary: Count of missing glyphs at the end of text shaping.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.ShapeRunsFallback
histogram.summary: This metric records the fallback font mechanism required to complete the shaping of a text.

histogram.name: RenderTextHarfBuzz.ShapeRunsWithFallbackFontsTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform RenderTextHarfBuzz::ShapeRuns with retrieved the fallback fonts. This metric is known to be quite slow on bad cases.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsProfile
histogram.summary: Count the clicks and displays of renderer view context menu item Open Link as Profile, as well as Open Link in Incognito Window for comparison. If Open Link as Profile is a submenu, it is counted as displayed even if the submenu is not open, and only counted one time regardless the amount of items in the submenu.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Shown
histogram.summary: Count of renderer view context menu items shown.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.Used
histogram.summary:
Count of renderer view context menu items (Only commands now) used. Note that this counts cases where the context menu item is used, but the item has no effect (eg. autofill commands have no effect if the RenderFrameHost is null). Update: as of M122, setting text direction via the context menu may also have no effect if the RFH is null, though we will continue to count in this case.
The user action RenderViewContextMenu.Used.IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SEARCHWEBFOR is also logged in case that IDC_CONTENT_CONTEXT_SEARCHWEBFOR is logged to this histogram.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: Snackbar.Shown
histogram.summary: Records the identifier of a snackbar every time one is shown.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ChromeLabs.{State}LabAction
histogram.summary:
Chrome Labs features user-facing experiments through a button in the toolbar.
This metric tracks which experiment (also called lab in the context of Chrome Labs) a user selects {State} for. This histogram is emitted to when {State} is selected in the combobox of the ChromeLabs dialog.

variant.name: Default
variant.summary: Default state selected for lab

variant.name: Disable
variant.summary: Disabled state selected for lab

variant.name: Enable
variant.summary: Enabled state selected for lab

histogram.name: Views.ColorProviderCacheSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the ColorProviderManager cache when a new ColorProvider is generated. New entries are generated when a client requests a ColorProvider with a Key that is not in the cache. Since the cache size is capped, a distribution with too many results at the tail indicate that the cache is too small.

histogram.name: Views.InvalidatesDuringLayout
histogram.summary: Records the number of times a view's InvalidateLayout() method is called during a Layout() call. Calling InvalidateLayout() during a layout call should never be necessary.

histogram.name: Views.LayoutCallDepth
histogram.summary: The maximum reentrant call depth seen during a view's layout. Normally this value will be one (Layout() was not reentered). But, we know Layout() is reentered sometimes in some views (where the value will be two), and want to measure how often that is. We also want to know if Layout() is ever reentered more than two deep.

histogram.name: Views.UnnecessaryLayouts
histogram.summary: Records excess layouts of a view that will not be visible. This includes doing more than one layout between paints, or any layouts after the final paint. While some such layouts might be unavoidable in computing layout-related properties during other operations, these mostly represent unnecessary work. The zero bucket counts cases where all the layouts we did were necessary, i.e. paints that had a single preceding layout.

histogram.name: Views.{Process}.NumColorProvidersInitializedDuringOnNativeThemeUpdated
histogram.summary: Records the number of ColorProvider instances constructed and initialized by the ColorProviderManager following a NativeTheme update in a {Process} process. Emitted after the NotifyOnNativeThemeUpdated() event has been processed.

histogram.name: Views.{Process}.TimeSpentInitializingColorProvider
histogram.summary: Records the time spent initializing a newly constructed ColorProvider instance in a {Process} process. The timer starts immediately before the ColorProvider is constructed and emitted immediately after initialization (i.e. all mixers are run and the ColorMap is created).

histogram.name: Views.{Process}.TimeSpentProcessingOnNativeThemeUpdatedEvent
histogram.summary: Records the time spent synchronously processing the the NotifyOnNativeThemeUpdated() event in a {Process} process. The timer starts as soon as the event handler is entered and emitted when code returns from the event handler.

histogram.name: WebUI.ColorsStylesheetServingDuration
histogram.summary:
The time in milliseconds to generate chrome://theme/colors.css and queue it to be sent to the renderer for WebUI. Does not include url parsing time. Recorded for every request for colors.css. Lower is better.
Expired Jan 2024. Revived M124.

histogram.name: WebUI.CreatedForUrl
histogram.summary: URLs for which Chrome creates WebUIControllers.

histogram.name: WebUI.Settings.PathVisited
histogram.summary:
Paths within chrome://settings visited. For evaluating popularity and priorities for chrome://settings GUI. Note that this metric used to include paths that were part of OS settings, but starting with M-81, this metric only records browser settings paths.
For Android settings usage check Settings.FragmentAttached.

histogram.name: WebUI.ShownUrl
histogram.summary: WebUI URLs that are shown to the user. For WebUIs that don't have a WebUI object (e.g. chrome://dino), recorded on the network request. For others, recorded on commit if not preloaded. For preloaded WebUIs, recorded when WebUIContentsPreloadManager::Request() is invoked. This differs from WebUI.CreatedForUrl as it only logs WebUIs that are actually shown (i.e., a preloaded WebUI may never be shown).

histogram.name: WebUI.TopChrome.Preload.Reason
histogram.summary: The reason of preloading a WebUI. Logged when a preloaded WebUI is created.

histogram.name: WebUI.TopChrome.Preload.Result
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to use a preloaded WebUI when a new Top Chrome WebUI is requested.

histogram.name: WebUI.TopChrome.RequestToFCP{WebUIName}
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed from the initiation of a WebUI request to its first contentful paint. This metric applies to the main frame documents of top-chrome WebUI pages, such as side-panel content. The request initiation is marked by the call to WebUIContentsPreloadManager::Request().

histogram.name: WebUI.TopChrome.RequestToLCP{WebUIName}
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed from the initiation of a WebUI request to its largest contentful paint. This metric applies to the main frame documents of top-chrome WebUI pages, such as side-panel content. The request initiation is marked by the call to WebUIContentsPreloadManager::Request().

histogram.name: WebUI.WebUIURLLoaderFactory.URLRequestLoadTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time for URL requests made through the WebUIURLLoaderFactory. The reported duration is the time spent in the browser process from the reception of the mojo request up to the content delivery through mojo call.

histogram.name: WebUICodeCache.FeatureEnabled
histogram.summary: True if WebUICodeCache feature is enabled. This counts the number of times generated WebUICodeCache JS code cache is instantiated.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user closed it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.CloseTabAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. This records how a user closed a tab within the WebUI tab strip.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad event and the RenderFrameHost DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the WebUI tab strip page. This happens once when a browser window with WebUI tab strip enabled is created. WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime should be smaller or equal to WebUITabStrip.LoadCoimpletedTime.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the RenderFrameHost StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the WebUI tab strip page. This happens once when a browser window with WebUI tab strip enabled is created. WebUITabStrip.LoadDocumentTime should be smaller or equal to WebUITabStrip.LoadCoimpletedTime.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenAction
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how a user opened it.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: The WebUI tab strip is a more touch-friendly tab strip used in place of Chrome's native tab strip in some cases. It can be opened and closed. This records how long it was open when closing.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabActivation
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from activating a tab from WebUI to receiving an activation notification in WebUI.

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabCreation{WebUITabStripTabCount}
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time needed to create all of the tab elements at launch. {WebUITabStripTabCount}

histogram.name: WebUITabStrip.TabDataReceived{WebUITabStripTabCount}
histogram.summary: WebUI Tabstrip: Time from requesting the tab data to receiving the data. {WebUITabStripTabCount}

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.TimeToAction.{Action}
histogram.summary: The time a user takes to select a menu item after opening the menu.
